alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Jackson; Kanawha; Lewis; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 6:30PM EDT until September 09 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Kanawha County in central West Virginia... Central Roane County in central West Virginia... Central Calhoun County in north central West Virginia... Central Gilmer County in north central West Virginia... Southeastern Doddridge County in northern West Virginia... Southwestern Harrison County in northern West Virginia... Northwestern Lewis County in northern West Virginia... Southeastern Jackson County in northwestern West Virginia... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spencer, Glenville, Sissonville, Arnoldsburg, Cedar Creek State Park, Kenna, Millstone, Mount Zion, Orma, Stumptown, Tariff, Shock, Normantown, Looneyville, Gandeeville, Walton, Harmony, Coxs Mills, Troy and Baldwin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Jackson; Kanawha; Lewis; Roane
